[Pangalay](/wiki/Pangalay) - [Sagayan](/wiki/Sagayan) - [Singkil](/wiki/Singkil) - [Subli](/wiki/Subli) - [Tinikling](/wiki/Tinikling) Singapore - [Dikir Barat Singapura](/wiki/Dikir_Barat_Singapura) Thailand - [Lakhon Khon](/wiki/Khon) - Fon - Hun krabok - [Lakhon Nai](/wiki/Lakhon_nai) - [Lakhon Chatri](/wiki/Lakhon_chatri) - [Lakhon Nok](/wiki/Lakhon_nok) - [Likay](/wiki/Likay) - [Manora](/wiki/Menora_(dance)) - [Ma yong](/wiki/Mak_yong) - [Mor lam](/wiki/Mor_lam) - [Ram wong](/wiki/Romvong) - Ram Thai - Rabam - [Kingkara](/wiki/Peacock_dance) Vietnam - [Nhã nhạc](/wiki/Nh%C3%A3_nh%E1%BA%A1c) - v - t - e ## Overview **Jikey** ([Jawi](/wiki/Jawi_script): **جيكيي**) is a traditional [Malay](/wiki/Malays_(ethnic_group)) dance drama that is popular in [Kedah](/wiki/Kedah) and [Perlis](/wiki/Perlis), [Malaysia](/wiki/Malaysia). The dance drama is known as [Yike](/wiki/Yike) in [Cambodia](/wiki/Cambodia) and [Likay](/wiki/Likay) in [Thailand](/wiki/Thailand). It is also popular in southern provinces of [Satun](/wiki/Satun) and [Phuket](/wiki/Phuket_(city)). ## History It is believed to have originated from the singing of [zikir](/wiki/Zikir) among the Malays, before it developed into a secular theatre after the late 19th century. The Jikey performance also has strong influence from other Malay performing arts like [Mak Yong](/wiki/Mak_Yong), [Hadrah](/wiki/Hadrah), [Bangsawan](/wiki/Bangsawan) and [Mek Mulung](/wiki/Mek_Mulung). ## Description The main elements of Jikey are improvised dialogue, [music](/wiki/Music) and [dance](/wiki/Dance), and local legends formed the main repertoire with considerable emphasis placed on slapstick comedy. The Jikey music consists of both instrumental and singing. The main characters are comedians, kings and warriors, and a form of *[leitmotif](/wiki/Leitmotif)* is involved as various characters in the drama are identified with specific elements in the music. A complete theatrical orchestra for Jikey includes [rebana](/wiki/Rebana) (with no jingles) in large, medium and small sizes; one [tambourine](/wiki/Tambourine); one hanging, knobbed [gong](/wiki/Gong), five or more pairs of *cerek*, one pair of *kesi*, an [oboe](/wiki/Oboe) (*serunai* for Malay or *pi* for Thai). However, typical ensembles consists only of a [violin](/wiki/Violin), 3 [rebana](/wiki/Rebana) and 2 *cerek* or [bamboo](/wiki/Bamboo) stampers.
title: Jikey
